raw_text:
Ref stands by Scotland decisions
 
 The referee from Saturday's France v Scotland Six Nations match has defended the officials' handling of the game after criticism by Matt Williams.
 
 The Scotland coach said his side were robbed of victory by poor decisions made by the officials. But Nigel Williams said: "I'm satisfied the game was handled correctly." Meanwhile, Matt Williams will not be punished by the Scottish Rugby Union for allegedly using bad language in his comments about the officials. He denies having done so. Nonetheless, he was furious about several decisions that he felt denied his side a famous victory. But Nigel Williams told the Scottish Daily Mail: "I spoke to Matt Williams at the post-match dinner. "He made no mention of the disallowed try or any other refereeing decisions whatsoever. "If Matt has issues with the match officials, then he is very welcome to phone me and discuss them. "Ultimately there is a match assessor at every international game to give an impartial and objective view of the performance of the officials. "That is the beginning and end of it."
llama3.2:1b: The referee from Saturday's France v Scotland Six Nations match defends the officials' handling of the game after criticism by Matt Williams, while Nigel Williams says he was satisfied with how the game was handled.
llama3.2:3b: Referee Nigel Williams defends Scotland's decisions in the France v Scotland Six Nations match, denying criticism from coach Matt Williams that his team was robbed of victory by poor refereeing.
Matt Williams denies using bad language to express frustration with refereeing decisions and invites Williams to discuss them.
gemma2:2b: Nigel Williams defends referees' decisions in the France v Scotland Six Nations match, stating he is satisfied with how they handled the game.
Matt Williams denies using foul language but expresses dissatisfaction with certain refereeing calls that he believes cost his team a victory.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The Scottish Rugby Union's commissioner, Nigel Williams, defended the officials' handling of the Six Nations match against France by saying he was "robbed" of victory due to poor decisions made.
But Scotland coach Robbie Burns said the game was handled correctly.
Matt Williams, who was criticized for his comments about the officials, will not be punished as he denies using bad language in his remarks about them.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Referee defends France v Scotland Six Nations decision-making; Matt Williams denied using foul language in criticism of officials' handling.
Scott Rugby Union maintains no punishment for alleged comment.
Match officials assessed via match assessor to ensure impartiality and objectivity.
qwen2.5:3b: Referee from France v Scotland Six Nations match defends handling of game, despite criticism by coach Matt Williams.
Nigel Williams assures proper decisions were made and denies punishment for Matt Williams' comments.
Despite Williams denying using bad language, Williams was not punished.
Nigel Williams says there's an impartial match assessor to view officials' performance.
opencoder:1.5b: Referee from Saturday's France v Scotland Six Nations match has defended the handling of the game after criticism by Matt Williams.
The Scotland coach said his side were robbed of victory by poor decisions made by the officials, but Nigel Williams responded: "I'm satisfied the game was handled correctly."
Meanwhile, Matt Williams left a positive impression on the players and the coaches for the actions he took, with it being decided that it's not against him to use derogatory language in his comments.
However, he remained content because he felt no penalty for violations.
Nevertheless, he expressed fury about several decisions made by him that he feels were misrepresented or unethical.
When Nigel Williams told the Scottish Daily Mail: "If Matt has issues with the match officials, then he is very welcome to phone me and discuss them", he added.
Ultimately, there is a match assessor at every international game for impartial and objective views of the performance of the officials.
However, these views are final and cannot be altered.
smollm:1.7b: The referee from Saturday's France v Scotland Six Nations match defended the officials' handling of the game after criticism by Matt Williams.
Referees are responsible for making decisions during a game, including those related to scoring, penalties, and other rules violations.
They must make these decisions based on their interpretation of the rules and their understanding of the situation on the field or court.
The referee's decision is final and binding, and they cannot be questioned or criticized by players or officials.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: The referee defended Scotland's handling after criticism from Matt Williams, stating that officials made poor decisions during the game.
Scotland's coach expressed concern over the officials' actions, while Nigel Williams acknowledged correct refereeing.
Matt Williams was not punished for using bad language, though he denied mentions of disallowed decisions or other issues during the post-match dinner.
If he had issues with officials, he would have been welcome to discuss at the assessor's table.
Ultimately, officials were assessed impartially at the game.
tinyllama:1.1b: In response to criticism from Matt Williams, Scotland rugby coach Nigel Williams defended the officiating of the Six Nations match against France by stating that he was satisfied with the decisions made, despite the incidental use of inappropriate language by Williams.
The officials' handling of the game, however, was not criticized, and there were no accusations of wrongdoing against them or their integrity.
Despite the coach's frustrations, no punitive action is expected for allegedly using bad language during the match.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Nigel Williams has spoken to the Scottish Rugby Union referee who officiated the France v Scotland Six Nations match, but not to Matt Williams, who was allegedly angry about certain decisions made by the officials.
The referee and his team are both conducting an inquiry into the game, which was decided in favor of France by a single point.

While it's unclear whether the inquiry will result in any sanctions for either party involved, Williams hopes that "the match assessor can provide him with impartial feedback" on the officiating during the match.
This is particularly important for Williams, who has had a contentious relationship with Williams and the Scottish Rugby Union over his comments about the officials.
phi:2.7b: The referee from Saturday's Scotland v France Six Nations match defended his decisions, while Matt Williams expressed frustration over perceived officiating errors.
Despite this, Nigel Williams assured that there was a match assessor at every international game to provide an impartial view of the officials' performance.

Matt Williams will not be punished for alleged bad language in comments about the officials and he did not mention any refereeing decisions made during his post-match discussion with Nigel Williams at the Scottish Daily Mail.
orca-mini:3b: The referee from the France v Scotland Six Nations match defended the officials' decisions after criticism by Matt Williams.
Nigel Williams said he was satisfied with the officials' handling of the game, while Matt Williams felt that several decisions denied his side a victory.
However, the Scottish Rugby Union will not punish Williams for allegedly using bad language in his comments about the officials.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: A referee defended the officials after criticism from Scotland coach Matt Williams, who claimed his team was robbed of victory due to poor decisions by the officials.
Nigel Williams, a commentator on the match, said he's satisfied the game was handled correctly and offered to discuss any issues Matt Williams might have with the match officials further.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Referee Nigel Williams defended the officiating in Scotland's Six Nations match against France after Scotland coach Matt Williams claimed poor decisions cost his team victory.
Despite Matt Williams' frustration, he will not be punished by the Scottish Rugby Union for allegedly using bad language, which he denies.
Nigel Williams stated he was satisfied with the officiating and noted that Matt Williams did not raise concerns at the post-match dinner.
He invited the coach to discuss any issues directly but emphasized that a match assessor provides an impartial evaluation of the officials' performance.
stablelm2:1.6b: Referee stands by Scotland decisions after criticism from Matt Williams.
Scotland coach claimed poor decisions robbed his side of victory, but Nigel Williams defended the officials' actions.
Matt Williams will not be punished for allegedly using bad language; however, he was upset about disallowed try and other decisions that denied Scotland a famous win.
There is an impartial match assessor to review official performances in future games.
granite3.1-dense:2b: The referee from France's Six Nations match against Scotland defended the officiating, despite Scotland coach Matt Williams' criticism that his team was denied a victory due to poor decisions.
Nigel Williams, Matt's brother and the Scottish Rugby Union's chief operating officer, stated he was satisfied with how the game was managed.
Matt Williams will not face punishment for allegedly using inappropriate language regarding the officials but denied making such comments.

Nigel Williams reassured that if Matt had concerns about refereeing decisions, he should speak to him directly or contact the match assessor, who provides an impartial review of officiating performance.
